HELP: The number of ports in a bridge.
The number of openflow rules configured on a bridge.
The total number of lookups in the datapath flow cache.
Number of missed lookups in the datapath flow cache.
Number of lost lookups in the datapath flow cache.
The administrative state of the interface. Possible values are: up(1), down(0) or unknown(-1).
The link state of the interface. Possible values are: up(1), down(0) or unknown(-1).
Maximum transmission unit size in bytes.
Link speed in bits per second.
The number of times the link_state has changed.
Number of packets dropped by hardware because the Rx ring was full.
Number of errors while transmitting packets.
Number of times a packet transmission was retried because the destination queue was full.
Number of times a guest was notifified of a received pkt on this queue.
Number of times a guest was notifified of a transmitted pkt on this queue.
Number of received packets that were delivered to the guest for this queue.
Number of transmitted packets that were received from the guest for this queue.
Number of recieved multicast packets for this queue.
Number of transmitted multicast packets for this queue.
Maximum number of milliseconds of idle time on connection to the OVN SB DB before sending an inactivity probe message
Maximum number of milliseconds of idle time on OpenFlow connection to the OVS bridge before sending an inactivity probe message
Specifies if ovn-controller should monitor all records of tables in OVN SB DB. The value of 0 means it will conditionally monitor the records that are needed in the current chassis
A metric with a constant '1' value labeled by ipadress that specifies the encapsulation ip address configured on that node
A metric with a constant '1' value labeled by sb_connection_method that specifies the ovn-remote value configured on that node
A metric with a constant '1' value labeled by type that specifies the encapsulation type that a chassis should use to connect to this node
Specifies the number of times ovn-controller has handled the packet-ins from ovs-vswitchd
Number of netlink messages that were received from the kernel were more than the allocated buffer
Specifies the number of messages that have been queued because it couldnâ€™t be sent using the underlying virtual connection to OpenFlow devices
Specifies the number of messages that have been dropped because of the queue overflow
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction has been aborted
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction resulted in no change to the database
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction did not complete and the client had to re-try
Netlink messages dropped by the daemon due to buffer overflow
Specifies the number of times the ovn-controller has dropped the packet-ins from ovs-vswitchd due to resource constraints
Number of times ovn-controller has translated the Logical_Flow table in the OVN SB database into OpenFlow flow
Specifies the number of attempts to connect to an OpenFlow Device
Specifies the number of attempts to connect to a remote peer (active connection)
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction has errored out
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction failed and the client had to re-try
Number of netlink message sent to the kernel
Number of netlink messages received by the kernel
Specifies the number of messages that have been sent to the underlying virtual connection (unix, tcp, or ssl) to OpenFlow devices
Specifies the number of messages sent to the OpenFlow Device
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction has successfully completed
Specifies the number of messages that have been dropped because the send queue had to be flushed because of reconnection.
Specifies the number of messages received from the OpenFlow Device
Specifies the number of times the OVSDB transaction were uncommitted
Number of iterations where zero packets where received
Number of iterations spent processing packets
Total time spent sleeping in microseconds
1 or 0 whether the CPU is excluded from automatic Rxq balancing.
Percentage of CPU cycles not related to one specific Rxq.
Number of voluntary context switches per PMD thread.
Number of non-voluntary context switches per PMD thread.
1 or 0 whether a vhost-user Rxq is enabled by a guest.
Percentage of CPU cycles used to process packets from one Rxq.
Version and library from which OVS binaries were built.
Has the DPDK subsystem been initialized.
